title: Advanced Diploma in Entrepreneurship
headline: Learn about the qualities of an entrepreneur and becoming a successful entrepreneur in this free online diploma course.
description: This free online diploma course provides a very detailed overview of the multifaceted domain of entrepreneurship. It will also help you to discover if you have the qualities of an Entrepreneur and how to raise finance.Also, it outlines multiple constructs for entrepreneurs to become successful. By the end of this training, you will be able to know the key stages of Entrepreneurship and how you can become a successful Entrepreneur.

courseDescription:
This free online diploma entrepreneurship course will help you understand entrepreneurship as a whole and the various stages of setting up an entrepreneurial organization from start-up to ramp-up. You will first be introduced to entrepreneurial Journey, followed by entrepreneurial discovery, where you will learn about how you can discover whether you have the entrepreneurial spark. This further leads you into ideation and prototyping. Which has to do with how you can ideate and develop a prototype which are the two foundational stages in setting up an entrepreneurial firm.

Next, you will learn about how your entrepreneurial idea will actually take shape in the real marketplace. You will also learn about how entrepreneurs challenge established products and strive to create a new industrial environment through novel products. This diploma course will also expose you to technological innovation and entrepreneurship, where you will later learn how technology interrupts the way businesses have been conducted. 

Furthermore, in this free online diploma course, you will discover how you can raise finances, especially if you have very scarce or meagre resources. Also, you will learn the relationship between education and entrepreneurship; how the two can be harnessed to become a successful entrepreneur. This course will also teach you when to leave the reins of an entrepreneurial firm that has been set up by you as a founder, in the hands of professional leaders; so that you could move on, to setting up of new entrepreneurial ventures. By the end of this course, you will have a strong understanding of Entrepreneurship and how you can become a successful Entrepreneur. Why delay? Start learning today.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this diploma course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this diploma course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison diploma is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital diploma: a downloadable diploma in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • diploma: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked diploma, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed diploma: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked diploma in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.
Start Course Now

All diploma are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison diploma, please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison diploma, you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our diploma pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

modules.name: Module
modules.description: This module outlines the various stages of setting up and growing an entrepreneurial firm from start-up to ramp-up and covers key aspects of entrepreneurship. You will also learn about the multi-faceted domain of entrepreneurship and the multiple constructs for entrepreneurs to be successful.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: This module focuses on self-discovery and self-evaluation. You will learn about the model of entrepreneurship that can be contextually adaptive while being person-specific in entrepreneurship. You will also learn about entrepreneurial personality assessments, which compares the different methodologies of deciphering a real entrepreneur; ranging from psychometric tools, Myer-Briggs, Type Indicator (MBTI) and BDC.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: This module outlines the importance and methodology of developing ideas and prototypes to establish workable propositions. Also, you will learn how to ideate and how to develop a prototype, which is the two foundation stages in setting up an entrepreneurial firm.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: This module covers the concepts of Minimum Viable Product and Ultimate Desirable Product. It also focuses on thematic criticality which outlines how the entrepreneurial idea will actually take shape in the real marketplace. You will learn about how Entrepreneurial firms or Start-up firms impinge on the market place.
topics: Testing Validation and Commercialization - Learning Outcomes
Reasons for Failures in Start ups
Testing, Validation and Commercialization - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: This module focuses on technology as a key driver of a successful start-up and sustainable ramp-up, with examples of how technology disrupts how businesses have been conducted. Also, it exposes the linkages between Technological Innovation and Entrepreneurship.
topics: Technological Innovation and Entrepreneurship - Learning Outcomes
Technological Innovation: Humatronics and Digital Limits
Digital Impact on Start up Spaces
Technological Innovation and Entrepreneurship - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: You must score 80% or more to pass.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: This module takes a further deep dive into Technology as a key driver of successful start-ups and sustainable ramp-ups; with additional real-life examples on how technology disrupts how businesses have been conducted. You will learn about the meaning of operations strategy, the critical elements in developing operations strategy and the characteristics of a competitive operations strategy in an entrepreneurial firm.
topics: Technology, Business and Operations Strategies - Learning Outcomes
Technology, Business and Operations Strategies - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Raising Finances and Developing Financial Strategy
modules.description: This module outlines the available options for entrepreneurs to access funds, the policy frameworks and other supportive options. Also, it explains how to raise finances; especially when start-up founders set up their companies with very scarce or meager resources.
topics: Raising Finances and Developing Financial Strategies- Learning Outcomes
Raising Finances and Developing Financial Strategies - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: This module explains how an individual's education can be leveraged in setting up entrepreneurial and start-up firms. Also, it explores the linkage between entrepreneurship and education. You will learn about how entrepreneurship is boosted with management, science and finance for Start-up transformation.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: This module explores the need for professionalism in start-ups, at the appropriate time of development and growth. Also, it outlines the challenges involved in leadership transitions with possible solutions. You will learn about the characteristics of a good CEO, founder or non-founder, the power and responsibility of advocacy in entrepreneurship.
topics: Beyond Founders and Founder-Familes - Learning Outcomes
Beyond Founders and Founder-Families - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: This module discusses the importance of and processes for leveraging entrepreneurship for generating employment in the economy. It also discusses the linkage between entrepreneurship and employment. You will learn about industrial transformations ideal for new entrants and how res-killing ventures boost the education sector.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: You must score 80% or more to pass this assessment.

slides:
• Learning Outcomes
  • Upon completion of this module, you should be able to:
    • Define entrepreneurship and explain the importance of entrepreneurship to the economy
    • Describe the importance of competition among entrepreneurs
    • Identify the different types of entrepreneurs
    • Compare the similarities between entrepreneurial and start-up firms
    • Analyze the importance of entrepreneurship as the foundation of industrial and business growth
    • Identify the five stages of having a start-up journey from seed of an idea to the pinnacle of its
      achievement in entrepreneurship
    • Differentiate between entrepreneurs and start-up founders
    • Identify the three key drivers in entrepreneurial Journey
  • Entrepreneurial Journey 

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Entrepreneurial Journey 

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Three Drivers and Fundamental Ways of Entrepreneurial Journey

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Three Drivers and Fundamental Ways of Entrepreneurial Journey

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Steps in the Entrepreneurial Journey (I)

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Steps in the Entrepreneurial Journey (I)

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Lesson Summary
    • Entrepreneurship is an essential driver of economic development. It is also the process of planning, launching and running a new business with the motive of earning profit and creating wealth
    • Entrepreneurship is important because it boosts economic growth by introducing innovative technologies, products and services
    • Increased competition from entrepreneurs challenges and also motivates the established companies to become more competitive and to renew and review their own methods of doing. So the economy benefits because newer products and newer services are brought in by the entrepreneurs
    • There are four different types of Entrepreneurs and they are: Innovative Entrepreneurs, Replicative Entrepreneurs, Opportunity Entrepreneurs and, Necessity Entrepreneurs
    • Entrepreneurs take risks to establish businesses, but not always based on new technologies. While Start-up founders take risks to establish businesses almost always based on a new technology
    • The five stages of having a start-up journey from seed of an idea to the pinnacle of its
      achievement in entrepreneurship are: Ideation, Prototyping, Testing, Validation and Commercialization
  • Learnng Outcmes
  • Upon Completion of this module, you should be able to:
    • Identify key Entrepreneurial Characteristics
    • Identify the methodologies and filters for used to discover if one has the entrepreneurial spark
    • Explain the importance of entrepreneurship to the national economy and methodologies to address the paradoxes of entrepreneurship in the journey
    • Mention the possible approaches to sustain entrepreneurial momentum
    • Explain who an Entrepreneur is
    • Differentiate between an Entrepreneur and a Professional Leader
    • Describe an Entrepreneur as an industrial pioneer
    • Explain the importance of Entrepreneurial Discovery
  • The Triggers for Entrepreneurial Quest

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • The Triggers for Entrepreneurial Quest

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Who is an Entrepreneur

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Who is an Entrepreneur

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Entrepreneurial Enigma

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Entrepreneurial Enigma

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Entrepreneurial Personality Assessments & Potential

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Entrepreneurial Personality Assessments & Potential

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Lesson Summary
    • Entrepreneurs have major characteristics that tell them apart from manager and those characteristics are: they have got lots of confidence in our own technical and managerial competencies which makes them to see a market opportunity or a product opportunity where other people do not see same
    • Entrepreneurship is important to the economy because it creates great economic wealth and creates huge employment
    • The triggers of the quest for entrepreneurship are: a dislike for the paid job system, a revulsion in working for someone else's satisfaction, a firm conviction in one's technical and managerial competencies, etc
    • The three aspects to an entrepreneur are: they have a purpose, they are creative and they have passion for their vocation
    • Entrepreneurs create an expanding role of entrepreneurship because they are inventors and they are builders of a nation's economy
    • Entrepreneurial discovery is a combination of: intrinsic entrepreneurial personality, acquired entrepreneurial experience, organizational and environmental expectations
    • Assessment of the intrinsic entrepreneurial personality can be achieved to a reasonable degree with personality tests and assessment
    • There are quite a number of entrepreneurial personality assessment tests and here are a few: psychometric tools, the more sophisticated tests such as Myer-Briggs Type Indicator (MBTI), BDC etc
  • Learning Outcomes
  • Upon completion of this module, you should be able to:
    • Explain the meaning of Empathization in entrepreneurship
    • Explain the meaning of Ideation and Prototyping in entrepreneurship
    • Explain the meaning of Thematic grid in entrepreneurship
    • Identify the stretches of Ideation and Prototyping in entrepreneurship
    • Identify the key elements of execution from design thinking in entrepreneurship
    • Analyze the importance of Patent for Start-ups in entrepreneurship
    • Identify the entrepreneurial areas that Prototyping is impacted by
    • Identify the characteristics of Prototypes in entrepreneurship
  • Entrepreneurship and Startup

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Entrepreneurship and Startup

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Design Thinking

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Patenting Essentials

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Patenting Essentials

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Lesson Summary
    • Ideation means and Idea while Prototyping is the reality of that idea and the processes involved in bringing that idea into fruition.
    • Empathization is a way of getting the ideas to fruition by understanding
      the customer needs.
    • A thematic grid is the core theme on which a product is built on. It could be Customization, Analytics, Digitization etc.
    • Prototyping is a proven and essential methodology applied to convert workable ideas into commercial products.
    • Prototyping is impacted by Design, Manufacturing and Materials.
    • Ideation Workshop is a special and specific methodology to enable firms, especially Start-ups and Entrepreneurial firms, discover and resolve problems to establish successful businesses.
    • A Patent is a form of legal protection by the governments provided to the owners of firms to exclude others from making, using, selling and importing an invention for a limited period of years.
    • Patenting helps firms, more so , Start-ups, protect their innovations and achieve competitive advantage.
    • Design Thinking is creative customization applied to a product, manufacturing and delivery process to fulfill more customer needs and provide more fulfilling user experience.
  • Learning Outcomes
  • Upon Completion of this module, You should be able to:
    • Identify the importance of testing and validation in an entrepreneurial firms journey
    • Define value addition in Entrepreneurship
    • Identify the differences between Testing and Validation
    • Identify the three types of products in Entrepreneurship
    • Define Bootstrapping in Entrepreneurship
    • Identify the four steps of Graded Testing in Entrepreneurship
    • Explain the meaning of Unicorns in Entrepreneurship
    • Identify the three strategies of Commercialization in Entrepreneurship
    • Explain the meaning of Disruption as a success driver in Entrepreneurship
    • Describe the peculiarities for digital Start-ups in Entrepreneurship
    • Identify the Granulated stages of Commercialization in Entrepreneurship
    • Identify the risks involved in aggressive Commercialization

  • Startups: Reasons for Failures (I)

  • Lesson Summary
    • Value proposition is a statement of gains and benefits from a product for the customer, both in the short term and also in the long term
    • A minimum viable product is that version of a new product, which allows a team to collect the maximum amount of validated learning about customers and its product with the least effort
    • The four steps of grades Testing are: Visible Testing, Pilot Testing, Holistic Testing, Final Testing and Validation
    • Bootstrapping is the process by which a Start-up is progressed with the least amount of resources and with minimal or external funding
    • Disruption is used to describe how entrepreneurial firms upset and change the way an established industry operates. They change the market dynamics, but they
      also grow the market substantially
    • Innovation is the way used by the firms to achieve disruption, and innovation drives
      positive and sustainable disruption through entrepreneurial and start-up funds. Innovation drives disruption, disruption drives new market dynamics
    • Innovation creates new products, and new products develop new markets
    • Unicorn is a term which was coined in 2013 by venture capitalist Aileen Lee to signify start-
      ups which secured valuations of USD 1 billion or more. Unicorn is such a term which is used in the start-up culture and the start-up framework to describe how companies are valued

  • Learning Outcomes
  • Upon completion of this module, you should be able to:
    • Identify the types of Technological innovations in entrepreneurship
    • Identify five examples of Technology-driven industries
    • Explain the meaning of Humatronics in entrepreneurship
    • Identify examples of global Unicorns
    • Explain the meaning of Non-linearity in technology, processes and models
    • Identify the five faculties of futurism in entrepreneurship
    • Identify the elements of customized product design
    • Identify the three steps of De-commoditization in entrepreneurship
    • Explain the risks associated with dependence on automated technology
    • Identify the challenges faced by leveraging digitization
    • Identify the advantages and limitations of digital assistants

  • An Analysis on Global Unicorns

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Lesson Summary
    • Entrepreneurial Black box is the activity which an entrepreneur does or what the entrepreneurial organization does
    • There are 2 types of innovations, one is a sustainable innovation and the second is a disruptive innovation
    • The examples of technology-driven industries are: Artificial intelligence, Bio-pharmaceuticals, medical devices, Robotics, Energy, Computers and electronics, etc
    • Non linearity implies inexplicability or unpredictability of cause-effect or input output relationships
    • Innovator strategies are: Application leadership, Experience leadership and experimental leadership
    • The five faculties of futurism are: Observe a future, Time a future, Learn a future, Imagine a future and Sense a future
    • Humatronics is a human performance enhanced by robots or robots performance made
      focused, more precise, more correct, more perfect and more emotionally balanced by
      human intervention. It is the best or optimal combination of man and machine

    • Start-ups tend to focus more on technology than on business value chain, diluting the power of technology as it flows from design to delivery
